topic.title: Managing Controller Nodes
topic.shortdesc:
You can replace controller nodes or disks while the system is
running.

section.p:
The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system uses exactly two controllers; you cannot
add or remove a controller. However, you can replace the primary or secondary disks,
and you can replace faulty controller nodes.

note.p:
If you are replacing disks in order to increase the controller
storage capacity, follow the instructions for .

li.p: Lock the standby controller.

Open the Hosts list by
clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.

Click
More
Lock Host
for the controller.
Wait for the procedure to be completed.

Power down the standby controller and make any required
hardware changes.

This may involve replacing disks, or replacing the host
completely.
Place the new or modified controller into service.
Power up the controller.

Wait until the controller is reported as
Locked, Enabled, and Available.

If required, reinstall the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software on the
controller.

If you are making disk changes to increase storage
capacity, you must re-install the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software. For more
information, see .

To reinstall the software on a host , click
More
Reinstall

Wait for the host to be reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online.
Perform a swact.

Click
More
Swact Host
for the active controller.

The standby controller becomes the active controller, and the
original active controller is placed into standby.
Lock the original active controller (now in standby).

Open the Hosts list by
clicking Inventory on the System Panel section of the Admin menu, and then selecting the Hosts tab.

Click
More
Lock Host
for the controller.
Wait for the procedure to be completed.

Power down the controller and make the same hardware
changes.

note.p:
The configurations for controller-0 and controller-1,
including disk types and sizes, must be identical.

li.p: Power up the new or modified controller.
If required, reinstall the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software on the controller.

body.p:
The updated controllers are now in service. The controller that was formerly active
is now the standby controller.
